page.title: 01LAND DESCRIPTION
page.content: THE AREA THAT THIS BLOCK COMPRISES USED TO BE MARSHY. IN THE PAST,DRAINS HAVE BEEN DUG ,AND LARGE DITCHES CALLED RHYNES HAVE FILLED WITH WATER TO MAKE THE LAND USEABLE.THE FIELDS ARE USED MAINLY FOR GRAZING.THE FIELDS ARE SMALL AND OWNED INDIVIDUALLY BY DIFFERENT FARMERS.FEW FARMERS HAVE MORE THAN ONE OR TWO FIELDS TOGETHER, BUT OWN OR RENT FIELDS SCATTERED ALL OVER THE BLOCK.THIS MEANS THAT THE FARMERS HAVE TO MOVE THEIR HERDS QUITE LONG DISTANCES,ALONG DROVES WHICH ARE TRACKS BETWEEN FIELDS AND ALONG THE ROADS AND LANES.MANY OF THE FARMS THAT USED TO EXIST AS WORKING UNITS NO LONGER EXIST EXCEPT IN NAME ONLY AND ARE NOW PRIVATE DWELLINGS THE LAND BEING USED BY FEWER FARMERS.
